item.title: Good Friday week is often a win for investors. Will that be true this year?
item.description: Markets are closed on the holiday itself, but the days leading up to it, especially Thursday, are often positive.

item.title: Why this strategist is expecting a lost decade for U.S. stocks, even without a recession
item.description: That U.S. exceptionalism argument is not going to work for the next five to 10 years, say strategists at BCA Research.

item.title: Trump’s tariffs are tarnishing the dollar’s global appeal. The damage may be hard to reverse.
item.description: The dollar’s safe-haven and reserve status may be in jeopardy after Trump’s April 2 tariffs.

item.title: Mortgage rates soar, prompting home buyers to seek refuge in adjustable-rate loans
item.description: Mortgage applications fell 8.5% in the last week, the Mortgage Bankers Association said.
